thread.section_title: Middlesbrough boss Steve Agnew forced to seek Jose Mourinho out for handshake – Metro
thread.title: Middlesbrough boss Steve Agnew forced to seek Jose Mourinho out for handshake
thread.title_full: Middlesbrough boss Steve Agnew forced to seek Jose Mourinho out for handshake

author: Simon Rice
title: Middlesbrough boss Steve Agnew forced to seek Jose Mourinho out for handshake
text:
Jose Mourinho at the Riverside (Getty) Jose Mourinho celebrated Antonio Valencia’s late goal in Manchester United’s 3-1 win over Middlesbrough by immediately heading to the dressing room pumping his fists.
It forced his opposite number Steve Agnew – who was taking charge of Boro for the first time – to seek Mourinho out for the traditional post-match handshake.
Manchester United make Premier League history with win over Middlesbrough Mourinho has been in a cantankerous mood recently due to his side’s heavy fixture schedule. Having played on Thursday in the Europa League he claimed Manchester United had many enemies and that he expected to lose to Middlesbrough.
In the end his side won 3-1, with Valencia scoring the final goal after Marouane Fellaini and Jesse Lingard had found the net earlier in the match.
Valencia took advantage of a shocking mistake by Victor Valdes (Getty) As soon as United had their third goal, scored in the 92nd minute, Mourinho leapt into the air then headed to the dressing room as he pumped his fists in celebration.
pic.twitter.com/LGf0urI3Vg 
— Safa Imtiaz Aly¨ (@iLadyUnited) March 19, 2017 

Agnew, who was placed in caretaker charge of Middlesbrough earlier this week after the dismissal of Aitor Karanka, revealed that he had sought Mourinho out after the match.
‘I made sure I went to see Jose and shake his hand,’ he said.
Agnew was placed in charge in midweek (Getty) More: Football Mourinho: This is why I went SIX at the back 
Man Utd fans rejoice as they move above 6th for first time since December 
Middlesbrough 1-3 Manchester United player ratings: Lingard the star 
The win for Manchester United moves them up to fifth in the Premier League heading into the international break.
MORE: Jose Mourinho explains defensive Manchester United changes during Middlesbrough win
